page.title: 04WASHINGTON HALL SCHOOL
page.content: The hall was built in 1854 then altered in 1859.Thomas Webb was the architect,building the house for John Lothian Bell.The building later became a Doctor Barnardo's orphanage,called Dame Margaret's Hall.It was named after a lady called Margaret who once lived in the hall.Another, one time, resident of the hall was a lady named Gertrude Bell, daughter of John Lothion Bell.Gertrude was the first woman to cross the Sahara Desert. In July 1977 the hall became a private school for maladjusted boys. They are not local boys but come from all over England and Scotland.Their ages range from 12to16.They sleep in dormitories.They have a recreation room and a lovely television room.As well as academic subjects, the boys do woodwork and gardening and keep lambs,hens and rabbits.
